class_notes:
The course is divided into three (unequal)  parts:  1) the life and career of Alexander III (`The Great') of Macedon ; 2) the legacy of Alexander's conquests in the ancient Mediterranean world,  with particular attention to the city of Alexandria in Egypt; and 3) the legends of Alexander's exploits from around the Mediterranean (and beyond) through which the conqueror became an `everyman's hero' for a multiplicity of societies. 
 
Required Books (available through Barnes and Noble)
 
Arrian, The Campaigns of Alexander
Curtius Rufus, History of Alexander
Plutarch, The Age of Alexander
The Greek Alexander Romance (Stoneman trans.)
A.B. Bosworth, Conquest and Empire: the reign of Alexander the Great (1988)
Peter Green,  Alexander of Macedon, a historical biography (1970/1991)
Pierre Briant, Alexander the Great and his Empire (first edition 1974, English trans.2010)
